metadata.synopsis: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a civilian that was caught in the middle. She stopped in Wakeen's Rest with her husband and daughter in the middle of their journey to Waterdeep for a wedding. She watched her family butchered by goblins before being killed herself.

49.speaker: Benryn
49.text: What's wrong with you? Let her go!
49.context: NodeContext: Benryn feels like the player is desecrating his wife's corpse.

60.speaker: Benryn
60.text: You're a medium! You're going to speak to her.

63.speaker: Benryn
63.text: Could you ask her something for me?

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I can't. She won't answer any more questions.

24.speaker: Benryn
24.text: Oh. It was probably pointless anyway.

65.speaker: Benryn
65.text: I'd hoped she could tell us where she took the dowry.
65.context: NodeContext: Sighs before the line. He's resigned, explaining something he knows doesn't matter.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I'll look around. Any idea where it's stashed?

26.speaker: Benryn
26.text: She didn't make it far. It'll be close.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Stop worrying about the dowry. It's gone.

61.speaker: Benryn
61.text: No, you're right. Those monsters could've taken it.

21.speaker: Benryn
21.text: She had her sister's dowry. I'd hoped she could tell us where it is.
21.context: NodeContext: Sighs before the line. He's resigned, explaining something he knows doesn't matter.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Maybe. What do you want me to ask?

38.speaker: Benryn
38.text: The dowry. She'd know where it is.
38.context: NodeContext: Having an 'aha' moment (but not excited - he's still grieving)

1.speaker: Benryn
1.text: It's for her sister's wedding. Miri had it when she ran out.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: This dowry? I'm keeping it as payment for saving your life.

69.speaker: Benryn
69.text: Fine. I hope you choke on it.

57.speaker: Benryn
57.text: Let her go. And go to hell.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I already found it. Here, take it. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

51.speaker: Benryn
51.text: I know this doesn't change anything, but it helps. Thank you.

19.speaker: Benryn
19.text: You can stop now. Let her rest.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I already know where it is.

17.speaker: Benryn
17.text: I trust you to get it for me. I can't leave her.

33.speaker: Benryn
33.text: The barn? She must mean one of the empty buildings behind the inn.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Be quiet. I have questions of my own.

22.speaker: Benryn
22.text: Please, leave her be. She deserves peace.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Why were you at the inn?

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Did you have any valuables nearby?

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*
